origin:
.@AOC: Do consumers ever explicitly consent to giving their data to you?

Equifax CEO: There is not consent by the consumer to give us the data.

AOC: So consumers own their data, but credit bureaus collect their information without their consent?

Equifax CEO: That‚Äôs correct. pic.twitter.com/KseNX9q6gZ
replies:
California has the #CCPA ‚Äî California Consumer Privacy Act. Europeans have #GDPR to protect consumers‚Äô data. 

It‚Äôs time for the whole US to protect consumers‚Äô rights to their own data!
...and consumers own the right to the profits from their own data! Every other vendor is paid for their raw materials.

@AOC is doing an amazing job, can't wait for more like her to rise to the same stage. She is fighting the hidden fascisms in our nation. Exciting stuff. #AOC #Bernie2020 #NoamChomsky pic.twitter.com/OoEjyyaAgi
She might have some problems soon. I hope not. Idk we'll see https://youtu.be/J-w5hAI09_Y¬†

Got to admit this was a big eye opener for me.  I was just accepting the status quo and never really thought about the credit bureaus accessing my data without consent.  It‚Äôs a great point in an increasingly dangerous digital age.
The other part of the Equfax scam and insult is that now your data has been probably breached multiple times. They are marketing data protection and monitoring services.
Someone made the point that our data is raw material and vendors get paid for raw material.  Maybe the credit companies should be sending consumers annual 'dividend' checks of some sort.
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs some nice data we collected on you. Be a shame if someone were to‚Ä¶ ‚Äòaccess‚Äô it.‚Äù
su_liam LauraFi79649513 d2creative tamiller1973 Public_Citizen AOC
When the product is free, you‚Äôre the product....
I love her willingness to examine everything.

It's funny how much we accept as normal with little question or thought. I believe a willingness to interrogate our accepted "norms" liberates us from the status quo and opens the door to new realms of possibility.
she's quite good at this part of her job
It just takes a little preparation, discipline, and caring about the policy, but in my experience 95% of Members mail this part in. She really is exceptionally good at it.
I have to wonder if not doing ‚Äúcall time‚Äù/worrying about the cynical parts of the job is part of why she‚Äôs good at it. (In addition to just being talented and prepared)
Though @aoc might be on a line of questioning, isn't consent given when you apply for credit and the continued use of the service through the credit company as opposed through the credit bureaus?
If that is how it works one would think the CEO of @Equifax would know that and not say ‚ÄúThere is not consent.‚Äù
There is no consent directly between the consumer and credit bureau but there is consent between consomer and visa.
Credit bureaus collect much more than just credit card data.
Right what I was trying to say is consumer and the company granting credit.
Utilities, cellular bills, and rent payments can be reported as well, though.
She asks the questions real, every day folks want more info. and understanding on. Thanks #NewYork for having the foresight to elect this young lady to represent
Oh please, listen to her interviews, she's as dumb as a box of rocks. Someone else gave her those questions so she could at least pretend to be smart. But her high school theatrics takes that away.

This was already exposed and reported on 7 years ago, she's a bit late https://www.judicialwatch.org/press-room/press-releases/jw-obtains-records-detailing-obama-administrations-warrantless-collection-of-citizens-personal-financial-data/amp/?__twitter_impression=true¬†‚Ä¶
Would be pretty hard for lender to loan money to prospective borrower with having their credit history. However, AOC might be inquiring about credit bureaus' other uses of personal information.

The interesting idea would be if consumers were able to consent to which credit bureau they want (kind of like a free market) and if Equifax cannot get their information right I can revoke their consent and work with the others.
Like, ones who weren‚Äôt hacked after laughably bad security lapses?  Yes, that‚Äôd be good.
Lost business and real fines might provide real motivation not to be utterly awful.
Soon people are just going to yell "I plead the 5th" everytime they see AOC.
Yes, they collect the data without consent and they also sell the data without consent. That‚Äôs actually the worst part.
They are also vulnerable to hacking... amazing this has survived for as long as it has.
There was actually a huge data breach with Equifax a few years ago. It was pretty bad. I thought Equifax would have closed after that.
Im still being punished by equifax breech. My accts are flagged and cards get cancelled a few times a year when a valid transaction is red flagged
Dang...I am so sorry. It sucks for real. Did you start any dispute process with Equifax?
A company too big to fail... so i got free credit monitoring for a year! Woooo in the meantime i may never be able to make a charge internationally again.
I know. It sucks. I am so sorry
it's ironic that the adult in the room is the youngest person in the room.
Not ironic. A sign of the times.

Thanks for highlighting this problem. Equifax is one of many data brokers who are scraping, aggregating, and selling our data without our permission. Here is an interesting discussion on the problem. Please read.  https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=13802068¬†‚Ä¶
Credit score is not a matter of consent. This isn't like facebook collect data. Ofcourse, people would want to hide facts which would hurt their credit score.
On the flip side is when they get something wrong they will not correct it. They shrug their shoulders like *someone else* is in charge of that. I've never had that happen but my Mother has.
No, that's true. The system is flawed but it's not a question of consent. That information should be aquired whether you consent to it or not.

But the thing is that people don't get a choice. It would be one thing where one credit report company was given permission for that level of access. But because its not, Equifax can screw up and not care because we don't get to drop them and go to a (In theory) better service.
I know that's why i said there are many flaws in the system
The worst part of the Equifax system is anyone can enter bad credit information against consumers with no notice or opportunity to dispute allocations.
I love it when she does this.
Does what? Make a clown out of herself?
They collect our data!  They sell our data!  Why am I not getting paid for my data?!!!

Because corporations and the 0.01 percent have bought--and own--almost every single member of Congress. In both parties.
(Which is why @AOC is such a breath of fresh air.)

Oh so everyone is owned except for the small time Bronx girl living in a luxury apartment? Makes sense..it's the government EVERYONE is owned. No wonder you guys are headed towards civil war. pic.twitter.com/NI40Ey7ASj
Got to credit her here.  That's just flat wrong that thesae credit bureaus can collect and profit from our private information without our consent and very hard to correct things if they get it wrong
Scary what you learn when you ask smarter questions.
Scary what the librrhoids can't grok due to brain-impairment, regardless of the question.
Thank you for asking the right questions @AOC.

Equifax CEO: Identity has been stolen 3 times. He should have bought 
#LifeLock  #LOL 
 https://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/news/2019/02/27/equifax-ceo-identity-has-been-stolen-3-times-in.html¬†‚Ä¶ via @AtlBizChron
I know you're joking, but the founder of Lifelock has had his identity stolen even more times because it's a useless scam.

Certainly credit scores have been abused, but a simple grant of permission if your applying for a loan, or insurance or anything else will solve it.  If someone is taking a risk on you, it would seem reasonable for them to have information whether or not to take you at your word
It depends on the nature of the work.  If the job involves managing and dealing with money, a credit report might seem relevant.
Yes of course for like fbi work or bank work I get it. But jobs in insurance and some administrative jobs ask for that shit... smh. I wanna get a check so I can have good credit... geeeze!

after looking into it some, most hiring practices involving credit scores mostly concern those who would have access to confidential data, which at times can include janitors who are cleared for the locations at which this sensitive data is contained. trust at all levels.
And then charge you to NOT use it. Sounds like blackmail.

A friend of mine has a large amount in savings but has never owned a credit card for fear of issues with credit companies. She was recently denied coverage by the ACA, because she ‚Äúhas no credit score‚Äù; I told her to reapply but denied 2x to covered California!
I love this woman.  She truly cares about the average person
We need to clone AOC .  THIS is what a Congressman/Senator should be like!  I hope she has a long and fruitful career.
What, all talk PR and photo opps? Faux outrage and megalomaniac ambition to become President and dictate to the New World order?
Get‚Äôem @AOC! Don‚Äôt back down. It‚Äôs time we the people take our country back.
They should jump start everyone with a 700 credit score for their foul and devious practices.
This woman makes a lot of sense . I hope something comes of this !
What‚Äôs that word for when you own something but someone else takes it without your permission again?
Show Katie Porter!!!!  There are people other than AOC. https://youtu.be/7tgZEgSlhA0¬†
I would welcome the opportunity to opt out of this arcane practice. Let‚Äôs make it happen. BTW what is the value of my personal data to Equifax?  Reparations seem necessary.

It‚Äôs not arcane, companies want to know what you want so they can adjust themselves to your liking. Look into MDM or big data or information technology. Unless you are really offended by companies know what you like it‚Äôs hard to argue against the good it‚Äôs causes.
It‚Äôs created an entire new industry, lowered product price levels, increased the US GDP, and made tons of jobs. It‚Äôs important to take deeper dives into important subject matters.
Seriously misleading. We might not sign a consent with Equifax, but we do with the loan maker to report to Equifax.
They gather a lot more information than loans

What information do they gather that you wouldn‚Äôt put on a loan application? I have limited knowledge of the credit scoring system, so I assume here, but I had thought it was all related to employment history and loan payment status.

If you have too many credit cards/not enough if you have too many credit reports done on you (which if you‚Äôre buying or renting a house or even a car it‚Äôs done) if a credit card is closed out it hurts your credit (if you don‚Äôt use them frequent enough they can do that)
Omg yaaas! This. All. Day! Insurance companies are the worst at it. They run your credit score (you may not know that) to get your pricing structure.
If you are talking car insurance , I did know that, and it‚Äôs ridiculous.
If you are not paying you loan on time you have less vested interest in your vehicle, makes perfect sense
@aoc we need to have a public conversation about why consumers don't SHARE in the $$$ that is made off the use, sale, and resale of their data.

@AOC's strategy in these hearings is BRILLIANT. She asks simple little questions that, individually, are irrefutable. Doing so, she ropes them into admitting things they wouldn't as a whole otherwise. 
We need more women like her in the U.S. Congress. BRAVO!
Socrates used something very similar. Read Plato

This should be stopped.   Equfax and others can't get your info correct,  then if you sign up with them to protect your identity,  your score goes up when you join but if you leave your score goes down.   WTF!

@AOC Asks the questions we ask from our couch every day.  She speaks for the working class. I finally feel represented. Most politicians are all talk until they get elected, then they focus on their own careers and pensions. Dance on AOC
If you‚Äôre ever being questioned by AOC and she says ‚ÄúThank you for saying that. I agree,‚Äù you‚Äôre about to go DOWN.
We are the product be sold.
Then I demand that @Equifax, @Experian, and @TransUnion to remove my personal data from their databases immediately.
We apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced. We would like to provide you the best course of action for your concern. Please follow us and send us a DM for further assistance. - Taylor H.
Our personal health information is private but our personal financial information is up for grabs. Maybe there should be a financial version of HIPAA? #credit #finances #strikedebt
Perhaps, but the cost of loans and credit will increase if loan officials have no way to evaluate risk.

These three credit assessing companies just appeared and made themselves ‚Äúindispensible‚Äù to the industry. As usual, consumers were not consulted about something that concerns them vitally. This system was just shoved down our throats. And the companies became instantly powerful.
I understand, but have seen no alternatives proposed. If left to individual banks and done on a by request basis, loans will be slowed tremendously and be more costly.
How did we ever survive without Equifax?
As it‚Äôs been around since 1899 who knows? I do believe that credit is easier now than it was pre-1899
Oooh, I can‚Äôt wait for @AOC to be President!
Understand what she‚Äôs fighting for; asking the questions that many voted in don‚Äôt.
Do NSA next. Then the rest of government.
She has the power to do nothing. And you think the NSA is going to answer her questions? You better think about that again.

If the connection was not clear enough - though it was for most to see - it was a criticism and a call for consistency with her calling out credit bureaus for not getting consent of the people of who are affected, as that is the nature of government.
You apply for credit in any form and it‚Äôs all in the fine print that you consent to this information being passed on. You don‚Äôt own it.

And the free agency period is coming soon for the NFL. If we‚Äôre going to make statements that have nothing to do with the point I made, that‚Äôs mine. AOC spoke of credit bureaus & consent; I spoke of the State & consent.
Arguably there is implicit consent here, at least. Not so with the ‚Äúthird-party doctrine,‚Äù which lets government access our data without a warrant. #legalizeprivacy
Could you explain "implicit consent"? It's my understanding that they access our private data, and there is no way to "turn off" our credit score. Maybe I'm missing something.

Right, but if you engage in credit-based transactions, you are arguably either explicitly or implicitly agreeing to have any deficiencies reported to warn others. What would the alternative look like? No accountability?

In credit-based transactions, it could be seen as implied. But don't credit scores access more than that? I'm no expert, but can't delinquent payments of any sort be gathered? If you owe a medical bill, they often send them to collection agencies, who report to credit agencies.
I'm not arguing, I'm just concerned about privacy and the reach of these credit agencies into everyday life.

me: Do Americans ever explicitly consent to giving their data to you?

aoc: There is not consent & we don't need it, cuz socialist agenda item.

me: So, to impinge the 2A & ration healthcare you'll coerce access to my info w/o consent?

aoc: That‚Äôs correct.

@AOC You would think by now someone would file legislation that would require #credit #bureaus to notify consumers that a merchant is about to put negative info in their credit file & give them 30 days to provide a rebuttal, not dump crap & consumers spend years  getting it out!
She's about to get everyone a 720 credit scores.

I love Alexandria Cortez. She is definitely for the people and asks the questions that are very important and i have never knew the errors the credit bureau was making.  Thank you Alexandria Cortez. We desperately need someone like you looking out for us.
People call her crazy, off the rails, an enemy of capitalism, but has anyone else noticed shes the only member of Congress asking well thought out relevant questions? The new kid does her homework.
This has to STOP! Thank You @AOC !
Go get these credit bureaus. They should not be in business unless they are regulated. Just remember they have allowed most of our information to be hacked and used.
So if data is property and is taken without consent, is that not the very definition of theft?
AOC is the most intelligent member of this house hearing.
Why?  Because she‚Äôs showing she has no clue how borrowing works?  She should‚Äôve followed it up with ‚Äúwhy don‚Äôt you just take people at their word‚Äù?
And most of there information is flawed...most consumers have no voice on what is reported...and no real opportunity to challenge the information taken. You go @AOC

Most of thier Information is correct actually.  

You don't have a voice to what goes in because people wouldn't let late payments or bankruptcies, etc go in.

Actually it's very easy to get it corrected. 

Ever request and look at your credit report?

@aoc = Soros funded trash
Anybody can report and you factually incorrect. All three credit services acknowledge that over 35% of what is gathered ovetall is incorrect.

35%?  So 65% is correct? Anything over 50% would qualify as most, so thank you for proving me correct.  

Anybody can report is factually CORRECT, except if maybe they have grammar like yours. pic.twitter.com/e0o0MoroCa
And we are only allowed free access to our own data once a year!
And they sell our information to anyone that will pay for it EVERY DAY
This goes way beyond credit - every app, subscription, or integrated microphone is stockpiling our information on a daily basis.
Does it really matter? Who cares? Do you really think that you have candy crush on your iPhone is all that important?
So there's a consent for getting medical and dental treatment but not for our credit
Go figure,.. things that make you go  hmmmm??

Thank you for bringing this up!! It always pondered on me how they can collect inaccurate data, at times, and it be your risk and responsibility to correct something that you did not give. That never made sense to me. Backwards logic. And they never update it correctly either.
Go get em AOC.  You are a disruptor.  Good.  Things needs a shake up.

It's like she is the most compelling prosecutor ever...such simple yet pointed questions that uncover so much. Most reps questioning any internet type companies have no idea what to ask...@AOC rocks it !
She's sure one to get down to the knitty gritty. I love her style.

I wish she was this good about Audit the Fed, economics, and Constitutional Rights. The only reason I tweet her is because she‚Äôs young enough to gain wisdom and change in better ways. She‚Äôs still addicted to debt though, like 90+% of congress. #changecanhappen #loveisbetter
Because is consumers never question or challenge anything. It‚Äôs sad but true. Many of us accept what is put in front of use and never challenge it. We have been trained to do that from birth. Sad
T R U L I E  Y U R Z‚ú®
She shaping up to be President
Should be done in two years. Back to bartending. And exactly what has she done except asked some questions? She has no power, no authority.

AOC, you are clearly one of God‚Äôs better angels.  As a former ‚ÄúBronx Kid,‚Äù more than twice your age, you are all that is good about ‚ÄúThe Bronx‚Äù and America.  Please keep speaking truth to power.  To coin ‚ÄúThe Blues Brothers,‚Äù you‚Äôre on a mission from God!  God bless you always. pic.twitter.com/6SapC8t2PY
Easy to poke holes.  What‚Äôs the alternative?  Go ahead and keep your data from a credit agency and see how easy it is to get a loan...
What I took from this is that not only are they collecting data but that a lot of it is wrong. If you're going to collect and sell data should it be at the very least correct and secure?

It‚Äôs free to pull your credit report once a year and not super difficult to ask for anything wrong to be removed.  People should take responsibility for their credit.  Not ask a company to do so and then get mad if there are errors.
So it should be our responsibility to double check a corporation‚Äôs data that they stole from us? I too praise our corporate overlords.
On what basis would you suggest a mortgage to be underwritten without credit reports backing a credit score?
The point is info is taken w/o consent and is often *wrong*, and their negligence in pursuit of profit causes real damage to people‚Äôs lives.
Unfortunately, this data is accessed for reasons beyond borrowing.
Right but not for insurance or getting a job that‚Äôs the issue

Exactly.  I wonder how people would feel if they lost out on a job because the employer knew they had more than 10K in student loans, so they were deemed not worth the risk.  Or had more than 5K in credit card balances.
I do as well. I understand. My only arguemebr was the use of said information from other parties other than those that we sign of too or lenders.... smh... that‚Äôs was my only argument.
We need laws against this bullshit!
a bit more accurate truth coming out...little by little w/the right questions..thanks AOC

this is her laying the groundwork for a social credit system like China's for the US. This person in abominable fraud you need to stop validating her. She also wants to suspend the constitution once she is President in 2024 pic.twitter.com/wpyzTW3Tzn
Now that she has the answer, what i# she going to do with it?
She'll perform. Part of younger generation that is still naive enough to think it and get it done.

Having your report pulled can negatively affect your credit score. How many people could this have possibly affected in a negative outcome to get a loan, buy a house, get a credit card, etc. If they are allowed to pull at will with no consent? Thank you @AOC

wait.... does her age also stop her from being considered for Vice President ...or Secretary of ..."any" department???
because if not....theeeeeeeen --

#AOC on
She‚Äôd be much more effective and over a longer period of time as a US senator.

So @Equifax @AskEquifax is a THIEF - stealing our data and privacy without our permission is thievery. The entire data-stealing industry should be dismantled and the Equifax CEO should spend time in jail.
Mmmm... could it be the creditors can provide the data to the credit agencies?  Meaning if you take a loan, the bank requires you to consent to the data being shared with credit agencies?

Equifax sells all of their clients data to marketing companies! They make you sign a NDA agreement in order to avoid any court proceedings. But @AOC is right to ask them about it because they do sell data. Address, Phone (Work, Home, & Cell), credit rating, Full Name, & Gender!

So ‚Äúconsumers own their own data‚Äù but at the same time @Equifax is making millions of dollars off of my data. So I never have them consent to use my data, which I own, to make money; however, they are doing so.
Class action lawsuit .   Bring it on!
Surveillance capitalism is the new American 'thing'. What I'd like to know is what's so American about it? The GDR had nothing on this!
I won't dignify your stupid set-up question with an answer.
Yes because its a stupid topic. Whats next all the data Google has on us.
The US has already implemented China's social credit system.
we are in soooo much debt to China! China OWNS us!
You‚Äôve somehow manager to be simultanously not wrong, but also extremely uninformed and totally missing the point...
I very much would like to understand why you say that we are misinformed and totally missing the point. Please explain your comment. Thank you.

That the US has massive loans from China has nothing to do with the either Chinese or American personal credit systems, which are atrocities in their own right. Both credit systems and state loans are big issues, but mostly unrelated. It‚Äôs not as easy as saying China = bad
What I‚Äôm saying is you‚Äôre lacking nuance. State loans from China have nothing to do with this. You‚Äôre oversimplifying.

Yes I understand your point. China does not equal bad. Im saying it is bad that the USA is borrowing so much money from China therefore putting us indent and beholden to China. Which is bad. Yes the personal credit system China just implemented is different issue.
Consumers agree on the acceptance of credit that their information and payment history will be shared with credit bureaus.
Asking really simple questions but what‚Äôs amazing is...why the hell hasn‚Äôt anyone asked them before @AOC came along.
because the people before @AOC were bought out exactly so they wouldn't ask anything.

I don't have a problem either pulling my credit history if I am applying for a loan but why use a score? I could have a 750 score today but if I use 25.00 dollars on a credit card it goes down to the 600's? That's ridiculous! And why pull a credit report when applying for a job?
Funny how in a preelection period some Congress members become Watergate style questioners. Where has AOC been?
@AOC may be one of the new kids on the block but she's certainly a breath of fresh air in that stagnant room

I read @AOC spends time going to committee meetings rather than raising funds. We see the outcome here of a politician doing her job; asking insightful questions and getting answers that serve the public good! Well done.
Equifax CEO: ...and we can do this because citizens are well-trained to be hapless and act like biddable "little people" who are afraid of pissing the credit bureaus off."
despite blunders, she's really really good at this part of the job.
American GDPR is coming. I'm ready.

The consumer signs loan documents w/ the lender stating they'll have payment history and loan data reported to the credit reporting agencies.  Not sure that is the data they are referring to.  I assume it's more likely the "personal data" like name, dob, SS#, that are at issue.

Yasssss! They deny credit based on an algorithm of numbers! Every time a landlord checks credit when you're looking for an apartment, you can expect a 3-4 point score drop. Ten apps, 30 points down.That is crazy! Racial bias also inherent.Consumer clearly identified by ethnicity

While I am all for privacy and knowing who knows what, credit scores only work if they have data. If you want to have that CS in your favor you accept it. If CS go out the window everyone will be assumed to have bad credit Not sure where she's going with this nor against question
Credit? Who was it made in the benefit of, as well as against: there is always opposition - subtle or not.
And you have to pay them for the privilege of seeing said data.
This I can get on board with. As a credit guy please ask me how the most important number you will never understand impacts your life. Horrible how this number is such a driving factor.
Where do we send Care Packages to help keep up your strength?
@AOC asks the most intelligent, relevant (to us common folk) questions I've ever seen out of a US Representative. We could us a few hundred more like her. #ByThePeopleForThePeople

These hearings are important because most people do not have enough financial education to retire with a free market system and social UNsecurity is short funds and/or tax payer base. #cannabis can provide enough tax revenue to fix both these issues. #financialedinhighschools

I wonder if a class action suit is available to consumers for the unauthorized use of data. I don't even have a credit score and have never had a loan or credit of any kind, but they have all sorts of info on me.
So they collect the data without consent AND make $$ of said data!   ...not only that but they‚Äôve been hacked multiple times exposing said data!!  this is crazy!
Great questioning by AOC. Frightening answers by data collectors. Keep asking!
As a conservative Republican, and a vanguard of privacy, I support this fully. My advice would be to partner with  http://EFF.org¬†. At a bare minimum, our data needs better safeguards.
I‚Äôm canceling all my credit and store cards. I‚Äôm a cash buyer from now on.
so good. so so so good. so refreshing. informed, intelligent, asks insightful questions.

this is a critical topic of discussion so please don't stop with credit reporting. the NSA, amazon, Microsoft, google, facebook, twitter in other words the tech industry.
did I forget Cambridge analytica?
Trying to put my finger on a word for somebody taking something you own without your consent...

Copying is not theft though . You still have your data. So they coined the term "intellectual property theft" which is 3 words. Or if you want to be more succinct, "copyright infringement", but you never declared copyright on your data and so it's public domain.
Yes I am. Especially when you ignore this ''.

I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôm comfortable with what she‚Äôs doing here.
Is she trying to shut down credit bureaus?
What‚Äôs the end game?
Maybe she wants to centralize credit reporting to a government bureau. Leftist love big government.

That would actually be a good idea.
However, based on this all data collection would have to be consensual and fall under the 4th Amendment.
There are problems with that as banks need a full picture.
The "full picture" has often been inaccurate and racially biased.

I think everyone commenting is missing the point: These R for-profit private companys that make $$$ on collecting PPLs financial info without their consent. We didn't create this problem, but we can end it. Out w/ the old, & onto something new/better. #EndTheFed Pull out the root

There is no harm done to a person via the collection of data. They aren‚Äôt harvesting your organs. The usage of that data is economically valuable however.
I don‚Äôt see how that aspect is ‚Äúbad.‚Äù
Perhaps I need more context than this clip.

Um... The harm comes is when only three companies monopolize an entire industry built on #debtslavery & therefore have the power to determine the financial future of everyone's livelihood. I respectfully disagree. Old system has to go. Anything is better then this BS. pic.twitter.com/XJAP2gI0HD

That‚Äôs off topic. The problem with banking if not the same as the non-problem of data collection.
Should I be angry at the company that cleans the bank too?
Credit (the topic)... Banking (what you keep bringing up).... Two different things booboo. Your off topic. Nice try. Try again. pic.twitter.com/gaFIOTfqLS

You mentioned ‚ÄúEnd the Fed‚Äù & ‚Äúdebt slavery‚Äù & ‚Äúpeople‚Äôs financial lives.‚Äù
I only mentioned banks in response to that.
My point here is that, from this clip, it‚Äôs unclear what AOC‚Äôs desired result is in regards to the bureaus.
We can only speculate as to what ACO's intentions. My point is the root of the problem is the FED.

yes seems this is an arbitrary biz, if consumers were to decide not to give consent even if explicitly asked...then credit bureau n financial institutions would make a point to deny them access to any loans etc in the future...guess sharing of such data is essential
They want that interest money- loans wouldn't stop being a thing, they'd just figure out a new business model.

And then @Equifax has a security breach of 146 million consumers and tries to sell us yet another product that will track our credit score in case of a breach. So Seems they created a problem to sell their new products?? @MassAGO this seems like a criminal act. @Equifax CEO pic.twitter.com/8x7qVbbwkN
So...Equifax wants to charge people by offering plans that will protect our data from their own incompetent actions.
She asks questions in such a way that gets to the truth QUICK!
